article.headline: New Mexico St. 104, Loyola Marymount 62
article.story: LAS CRUCES, N.M. -- Sophomore guard Jahmar Young scored a season-high 30 points Sunday to lead New Mexico State past Loyola Marymount 104-62 in the Aggies' highest scoring game this season. The Aggies (6-6) ended a two-game losing streak, while the Lions, playing Sunday without their coach, are 0-14. Aggie guard Jonathan Gibson added 20 points for New Mexico State, while forward Wendall McKines hit 12 points and 12 rebounds. New Mexico State went 17-for-27 from 3-point range and shot 53.7 percent from the field. The 17 3-pointers were two short of a school record. LMU guard Corey Counts led the Lions with 19 points. He was the only Lion to shoot better 50 percent from the field, making 6 of his 11 shots. Loyola Marymount coach Bill Bayno has been on a leave of absence due to what he has called a "serious medical condition" related to job stress. The Lions shot just 27.7 percent from the field for the game. The Aggies made their first 11 shots of the game en route to a 59-32 halftime lead. The Lions used a 12-0 run in the first half to pull within 30-24 with 8:26 remaining. But New Mexico State pulled ahead with a 29-8 run over the final 8:13 of the first half. In the first half, Young led all scorers with 16 points. He was 3-for-3 from 3-point range and 5-for-6 from the foul line. McKines followed with 12 points and Gibson had 10 points in the first half. Loyola Marymount shot just 28.6 percent from the field in the opening half and was just 2-for-8 from 3-point range. Forward Kevin Young and guard Jarred Dubois led the Lions with eight points apiece in the first half.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
